nodes.bodyText:
Given where we're at in 1.4, I wouldn't make such a big change now; use of this map predates the workarounds made for the specific Qt issue, so worry there are other side effects/reasons we might be missing here.
Plus we've never tested reliability of NavigationType in the context of Qt 5.12.8, which this code will still be using in everything but Mac desktop, so hate to open up that can of worms.
Maybe open a separate tracking issue to revisit cleaning this up in juliet-rose when we have a bit more time to validate?

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -382,15 +370,12 @@ bool isSafeHost(const std::string& host)
 
 } // end anonymous namespace
 
-// NOTE: NavigationType is unreliable, as per:
-//
-//    https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-56805
-//
-// so we avoid querying it here.
 bool WebPage::acceptNavigationRequest(const QUrl &url,
-                                      NavigationType /* navType*/,
+                                      NavigationType navType,
                                       bool isMainFrame)
 {
+   qDebug() << url << "[" << navType << "]";

nodes.bodyText: Should this be doing return isSafeHost(host); instead of just return true?

Nervous about relying on navType in Qt 5.12.8, just because it introduces the need to retest this on all platforms. How about this just stays as "else", thus wrapping all use of navType in the QT_VERSION >= 5.15 and making this change a no-op for anything but Mac w/5.15?

Don't think we need to add this to safe hosts; the issue wasn't that this wasn't being allowed (which is also the case in RStudio 1.2 and 1.3 and didn't seem to be a concern) but that we are now opening it in system browser.
I'd leave this in (per earlier comment about minimizing the change).

       return true;
 #endif

-   // an iframe, check it's from a safe host
-   if (!isLocal && s_subframes.count(url))
